p: An Agilent Technologies (Palo Alto, CA, USA) gas chromatograph model 7890A equipped with the mass selective detector, model 5977E, and capillary column HP-5MS (5%-phenyl)-methylpolysiloxane (Agilent J & W; Santa Clara, CA, USA) GC column, 30 m, 0.25 mm i.d., coating thickness 0.25 μm was used. The flow rate of the helium carrier gas was 1.5 mL min −1. The injector was operated in split mode (2:1 split ratio) at 260 °C. The column was maintained at 40 °C for 3 min, heated to 100 °C at a rate of 5 °C min −1, heated to 260 °C at a rate of 3 °C min −1, and held to 260 °C for 3 min. MS conditions were as follows: source temperature 230 °C; quadrupole temperature 150 °C; transfer line temperature 270 °C; acquisition mode electron impact (EI 70 eV) by 3 scans s−1, and mass range m/ z 29–350. The analyses were carried out in triplicate. The individual peaks were identified by comparison of their retention indices (relative to C9–C25 n-alkanes for HP-5MS) to those of authentic samples and literature as well as by comparing their mass spectra with the Wiley v9-MS library (Wiley, New York, NY, USA) and NIST14 (National Institute of Standards and Technology; Gaithersburg, MD, USA) mass spectral database [ 24].
